entities.label: SASB Standards
entities.description: Standards intended to aid entities in disclosing information about sustainability-related risks and opportunities that could affect cash flows, access to finance or cost of capital

entities.label: Commercial Banks
entities.description: Banks that accept deposits and make loans to individuals and corporations, and engage in lending to infrastructure, real estate and other projects

entities.label: Sustainability-related risks and opportunities
entities.description: Risks and opportunities that could reasonably be expected to affect entity's cash flows, access to finance or cost of capital over short, medium or long term

entities.label: SICS
entities.description: Sustainable Industry Classification System used to identify primary industry for SASB Standards application

entities.label: Disclosure topics
entities.description: Topics identified as likely to be useful to investors for sustainability reporting

entities.label: ESG Metrics
entities.description: Associated metrics for disclosure topics that entities should consider reporting

entities.label: Materiality
entities.description: Judgements and determinations that rest with the reporting entity regarding what information to disclose

entities.label: Regulatory environment
entities.description: Governing framework for commercial banking industry that witnessed significant changes after 2008 global financial crisis

entities.label: Data Breaches
entities.description: Number of data breaches, percentage that are personal data breaches, number of account holders affected

entities.label: Data Security Risk Approach
entities.description: Description of approach to identifying and addressing data security risks

entities.label: Small Business and Community Development Loans
entities.description: Number and amount of loans outstanding that qualify for programmes designed to promote small business and community development

entities.label: Past Due Community Development Loans
entities.description: Number and amount of past due and nonaccrual loans or loans subject to forbearance that qualify for programmes designed to promote small business and community development

entities.label: No-Cost Retail Checking Accounts
entities.description: Number of no-cost retail checking accounts provided to previously unbanked or underbanked customers

entities.description: Number of participants in financial literacy initiatives for unbanked, underbanked, or underserved customers

entities.description: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors in credit analysis

entities.description: Absolute gross financed emissions, disaggregated by Scope 1, Scope 2 and Scope 3

entities.label: Gross Exposure by Industry
entities.description: Gross exposure for each industry by asset class

entities.description: Percentage of gross exposure included in the financed emissions calculation

entities.label: Financed Emissions Methodology
entities.description: Description of the methodology used to calculate financed emissions

entities.label: Data Security
entities.description: Topic covering data breaches and security risk management

entities.label: Financial Inclusion & Capacity Building
entities.description: Topic covering small business loans, community development, and financial literacy

entities.description: Topic covering integration of ESG factors in credit analysis

entities.description: Topic covering financed emissions measurement and reporting

entities.description: Description of whistleblower policies and procedures

entities.description: Global Systemically Important Bank (G-SIB) score, by category

entities.description: Description of approach to integrate results of mandatory and voluntary stress tests into capital adequacy planning, long-term corporate strategy, and other business activities

entities.label: Checking and savings accounts
entities.description: Number and value of checking and savings accounts by segment: (a) personal and (b) small business

entities.label: Loans by segment
entities.description: Number and value of loans by segment: (a) personal, (b) small business, and (c) corporate (excluding mortgage and revolving credit loans)

entities.label: Data breaches
entities.description: Number of data breaches, percentage that are personal data breaches, number of account holders affected

entities.description: Covers monetary losses from legal proceedings and whistleblower policies

entities.description: Covers G-SIB scores and stress test integration approaches

entities.description: Ensuring personal financial data privacy and security, including safeguarding against cybersecurity threats

entities.description: Number of data breaches, percentage involving personally identifiable information (PII), and number of account holders affected

entities.description: Description of approach to identifying and addressing data security risks

entities.label: Small Business and Community Development Loans
entities.description: Number and amount of loans outstanding that qualify for programmes designed to promote small business and community development

entities.label: Data Security
entities.description: Protection of customer data and information systems from unauthorized access and breaches

entities.label: Financial Inclusion & Capacity Building
entities.description: Extending credit and financial services to unbanked, underbanked or underserved customers while improving financial literacy

entities.description: Incidents where encrypted data was acquired along with encryption key

entities.description: Total number of unique account holders affected by personal data breaches

entities.description: International standard for information security management

entities.description: Actions taken in response to data breaches including changes in operations, management, processes, products, business partners, training or technology

entities.description: New and emerging cyber threats including those from near-field communication payment systems, mobile banking and web-based banking

entities.label: Commercial Banks

entities.description: Number and amount of past due and nonaccrual loans or loans subject to forbearance that qualify for programmes designed to promote small business and community development

entities.description: Number of no-cost retail checking accounts provided to previously unbanked or underbanked customers

entities.label: Financial literacy initiative participants
entities.description: Number of participants in financial literacy initiatives for unbanked, underbanked, or underserved customers

entities.label: Community development loans
entities.description: Loans primarily funding community services targeted to low- or moderate-income individuals, and the development, revitalisation or stabilisation of low- or moderate-income regions

entities.label: Small business loans
entities.description: Loans to small businesses and farms that qualify for programmes designed to promote small business and community development

entities.label: Unbanked customers
entities.description: Individuals and families who have rarely, if ever, held a checking account, a savings account, or other type of transaction account at an insured depository institution

entities.label: Underbanked customers
entities.description: Households with a checking or savings account that used alternative financial services (AFS) provider products in the past 12 months

entities.label: Underserved customers
entities.description: Customers who are unbanked, underbanked or otherwise have limited access to mainstream financial services, often because of limited or no credit history

entities.label: Financial literacy initiatives
entities.description: Educational programmes, workshops, seminars, courses, counselling and community partnerships for unbanked, underbanked or underserved customers

entities.description: Short- and long-term strategy integrating examination results for financial inclusion and capacity building

entities.description: Integration of environmental, social and governance factors into lending processes and credit analysis
